body_html:
@Androbin Yes, it's possible to do exactly what you're asking. The tool you're looking for is https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/tools/print_selective_registration_header.py, used in conjunction with -DSELECTIVE_REGISTRATION.

If you have any specific ops you'd like to see supported by default please submit a PR. Due to selective registration we don't need to be too picky about adding ops for size reasons, but as every new op has the potential to add extra maintenance on mobile we tend to add them as needed by graphs, rather than proactively.

body:
@Androbin Yes, it's possible to do exactly what you're asking. The tool you're looking for is https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/tools/print_selective_registration_header.py, used in conjunction with -DSELECTIVE_REGISTRATION.

If you have any specific ops you'd like to see supported by default please submit a PR. Due to selective registration we don't need to be too picky about adding ops for size reasons, but as every new op has the potential to add extra maintenance on mobile we tend to add them as needed by graphs, rather than proactively.
